Class Movement

java.lang.Object
domain.Movement
All Implemented Interfaces:
Attackable, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PhysicalMovement, SpecialMovement
public abstract class Movement extends Object implements Attackable, Serializable

  • Constructor Details

    • Movement

      public Movement(String newName, String newDescription, int newPP, int newPower, int newPrecision, PokemonType newType, int newpPriority)
      Constructor for creating a new Movement Initializes the movement with the specified parameters. PP (Power Points) are automatically adjusted based on power - stronger moves have fewer uses.
      Parameters:
      newName - The name of the movement
      newDescription - A description of what the movement does
      newPP - The initial Power Points (PP) available for this movement
      newPower - The base power of the movement
      newPrecision - The accuracy percentage of the movement
      newType - The elemental type of the movement
      newpPriority - The priority level of the movement in battle

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of this movement
      Returns:
      The name of the movement

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Gets the description of this movement
      Returns:
      The description of the movement

    • getPrecision

      public int getPrecision()
      Gets the accuracy (precision) of this movement
      Returns:
      The accuracy percentage value

    • getType

      public PokemonType getType()
      Gets the elemental type of this movement
      Returns:
      The PokemonType of the movement

    • getPriority

      public int getPriority()
      Gets the priority level of this movement in battle Higher priority moves are executed first
      Returns:
      The priority value

    • getMultiplicator

      public double getMultiplicator(PokemonType defender)
      Calculates the type effectiveness multiplier against a defending Pokemon type Uses a pre-defined effectiveness table to determine damage multiplication
      Specified by:
      getMultiplicator in interface Attackable
      Parameters:
      defender - The PokemonType of the defending Pokemon
      Returns:
      A multiplier value representing type effectiveness (e.g. 2.0 for super effective)

    • getPP

      public int getPP()
      Gets the remaining Power Points (PP) available for this movement
      Returns:
      The current PP value

    • getPower

      public int getPower()
      Gets the base power of this movement
      Returns:
      The power value

    • limitOfTime

      public void limitOfTime()
      Method for handling time-based limitations Empty implementation, to be overridden by subclasses if needed

    • losePP

      public void losePP() throws PoobkemonException
      Decreases the PP by one after using the movement
      Throws:
      PoobkemonException - INVALID_VALUES if PP would become zero or negative

    • canMakeMove

      public boolean canMakeMove()
      Checks if this movement can be used (has enough PP)
      Returns:
      true if PP is greater than zero, false otherwise

    • doAttackTo

      public abstract int doAttackTo(Pokemon attacker, Pokemon target) throws PoobkemonException
      Executes the attack from one Pokemon to another Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses
      Specified by:
      doAttackTo in interface Attackable
      Parameters:
      attacker - The Pokemon performing the attack
      target - The Pokemon receiving the attack
      Returns:
      The amount of damage dealt
      Throws:
      PoobkemonException - Various exceptions depending on the implementation

    • AttackToStruggle

      public void AttackToStruggle(Pokemon attacker, Pokemon target)
      Performs a struggle attack that damages both the target and the attacker Used when a Pokemon has no other moves available
      Parameters:
      attacker - The Pokemon performing the attack
      target - The Pokemon receiving the attack

    • copy

      public abstract Movement copy()
      Creates a copy of this Movement with the same properties Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses
      Returns:
      A new Movement object with identical properties
